comments.html:
I'm positive there's tons of information out there, but not much on using infrastructure-as-code approach in networking.

We did a bit of that in the network automation online course (Mark Prior had a great presentation in the spring 2018 session: https://my.ipspace.net/bin/list?id=NetAutSol&module=1#INFRA_AS_CODE and Pete Lumbis talked about CI/CD here https://my.ipspace.net/bin/list?id=NetAutSol&module=5#M5S3A), and I plan to have a separate session focused on this topic (resulting in a new course module) in autumn. I also covered how you can manage device configurations with Git here: https://my.ipspace.net/bin/list?id=NetAutSol&module=2#M2S2B

If you don't like my webinars and courses :( then the only good book I could recommend on network automation (not sure whether they deal with infrastructure-as-code) is http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920042082.do. There's also a pretty good intro presentation from RIPE71: https://ripe71.ripe.net/archives/video/154/

Further pointers obviously much appreciated.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Join this slack workspace - and just read the chats. Many good links and many of the most active network -> dev guys frequent these channels.

https://networktocode.slack.com/

comments.html: Is there any material on infrastructure as a code you can recommend? Any books?
